text: 0,375 l bottle from kappldav123, so far as I remember.Thanks a lot! Unclear pale orange in the glass. One finger frothy head. Very fruity on the nose.Taste starts with a strong dry sourness. Some smooth malty hints in the background. Wood. Alcoholic elements. Nice tart aftertaste. Strong.
Pite z butelki. W aromacie bardzo mocna stajnia, pestki. W smaku mocny kwas, ciƒô≈ºko pijalne z powodu zalegajƒÖcej kwa≈õno≈õci, ale bardzo fajny wp≈Çyw beczki.

Bottle (375 ml) at home. Clear bright orangey-golden with a medium white head, good retention, leaving a long lasting ring of foam. Aroma is rather strong - ala Boon Mariage Parfait - with oak features and funk aplenty, musty notes, cognac fruitiness and light apples notes. Taste is gently acidic but mostly funky with oak, oak spiciness, lemon, green apples (but not in a bad way), musty notes, wet hay, cognac fruitiness and light alcohol presence. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Lemony finish with some fruitiness, oak and funk. Very complex but still on the drinkable side. The cognac barrels, despite being 4th fill, seems to give this one more fruitiness than usual Boon blends. Nice funk and oak features. Very good!
Bottle. Pours lightly hazy golem orange, small off white head, decent lacing. Aroma of light oak, basement, Brett, lemon. Flavor is dry, light funk, clear. Light plus body. 79 is much more complex.
Bottle. Pours golden with white head. Aroma: cow shit, hay, sulphur, berriues, raw apple peal. Taste: raw apples, sulphur, medium sour, tarmac. Medium body. Sour finish.

375 ml bottle. Drank side-by-side with an aged Boon 44. Beautiful deep golden-orange color with light have and a low, thick head. Nose is grapefruit, leather, old books, horse blanket, orange, and some honey. Very sharp, bretty, funky. Fruity, citrsus flavor with lots of funky horse blanket. Sharp and acidic. Very nice but the aded 44 is much nicer, which makes me want to get a couple more of these to age a few years.

Tasting @ fillepolo 20170610. Bottle (375 ml) from Kihoskh, Copenhagen. Fruity and woody, acidic and funky, vanilla notes, grapes, medium body with a watery to oily texture .The finish is dry, funky and fruity.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2017 Beer tasting @ fillepolo 10/6-17. Bottle from Kihoskh, Copenhagen. Fruity, bretty and woody with grapes and notes green apples, also acidic. Body is medium, the finish is dry, fruity, bretty and acidic.
Bottle from kioskh copenhagen. Pours a golden colour beer with a small head. Bretty and fruity with notes of grapes and green apples. Dry finish.

375ml bottle. Pours dark golden yellow colour. Thin white head. Earthiness, funk, notes of grapefruit, slight acidity, slight barnyard in the aroma. Slight acidity, notes of grapefruit, citrussy notes, earthy notes. Earthy notes. Bitter, grapefruity finish. Grapefruit in the aftertaste. Rather medium bodied, well balanced and surprisingly fruity gueuze.

Dimmig, apelsinskals gul-orange, gulaktigt skum. Doft: Jord, sj√∂vatten, funk, lite stall och halm, √§pplen, f√§rskt tr√§, mandarin. Smak: J√§st √§ppeljuice, malt, funk, gr√§s, det vita i citrus skal, beskan i grape.

Many thanks to Erzengel for sharing! Pours slightly hazy golden colour. Aroma of mild tart fruits, pale malt, wood, vanilla, yellow fruits. Taste of sweet wood, vanilla, ripe fruits, grapes, herbs, delicious!
niedojrzale owoce, skora, stajnia, miod? do tego nuta szlachetnego alkoholu, klasa... poniedzialek nie musi byc smutny :)

Bottle Sunday 4 June, Utrecht. Apricot honey color; dark champagne. And there's a big head, though not nearly as fizzy in the mouth as one might have expected. Funky nose, with some very nice apricot and almond notes. Full and round in the mouth; more apricot! Truly delicious. A highlight of my stay in the Netherlands and one of the best beers I've tasted on this trip. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Weich s√§uerlicher Antrunk. Starke Brettnoten, gelungen milde Karbonisierung. Intensive helle Holznoten, trocken bitter, rund. 10/10/10/10//10

Bottle courtesy of Maakun. Hazy orange golden, thin cream head. Sweet and sour apricot, hay, hint of iron, white grapes, grapefruit, nutmeg, apricot stone. Moderate sweet and bitter, only light sour. Over medium body, soft carbonation. Almost syruppy feel. Very nice rich and warming aroma.

Bottle shared, luckily I had the foresight to open this outside, now there¬ís a cork in sjogro¬ís neighbors garden. Slight hazy dark golden with fizzy off white head. Nice funk, soft caramel, hay, almonds, apricot, light oxidized wine, sherry and cognac notes. It¬ís quite malty as well, which makes for a medium sweetness. Soft grassy bitterness and it¬ís under medium sour throughout. Medium bodied with quite some fizzy carbonation. Very nice but maybe a bit too much carbonation and alcohol.

Bottle from Speciaalbierpakket. Aroma is barnyard funk, oak, fruity notes, citrus, some lemon, with a slight hint of Cognac including grapes. Flavour is sour but not extremely so, with some bitterness in the finish. Body is medium. Pretty damn tasty.

37.5cl bottle. Fresh smooth sour body. Horse-blanket, very smooth. Fresh smooth mild beginning. The beer has woody hints, the cognac is there in the back, nice woody sour mild body. Fresh sour aftertaste, fresh, intense, round and woody. Great stuff!

Thanks to erzengel for sharing!! Pours a hazy apricot color with an off white head. The smell is woody, earthy, minerally, some funk and dry fruitiness. The taste is minerals, toasted grain, some fruit, wood, very dry ending. The beer is active in carbonation yet with fine structure and a light body. Very nice!

375ml bottle from Taniguchi served in my Geuze Boon glass. An opaque orange gold color with a soapy film of foam. It has a tart oaky aroma which gives me a scent of peaches and cream. Full bodied and prickily carbonated. The taste is cork, oak, peaches and pears. A lovely gueuze.
Bottle. Hazy orange color. Thin persistent white head. Taste is medium sour, medium bitter, light to medium sweetness. Aroma and flavour is brett, honey, brandy, grass, horse blanket.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2017 From a 375ml bottle on 21/5/2017 (ABV listed as 8.25%). Pours a cloudy golden with a smallish head which disappears quickly. The nose is sharp, with white grape, yeast with lots of vinous elements to it. Taste wise, it¬ís just firmly sour, with citrus rind falvours. It¬ís earthy, sharp, zesty, bretty, and a touch spicy, but not in a way that is remotely interesting or rewarding. Has quite a bit champagne like character to it, with a touch of cognac in the mix. Medium bodied with lively carbonation. I¬ím clearly in the minority here, but I found it difficult to identify anything  remotely pleasant about it.

Golden color. Tons of carbonation. Nice oaky nose, with subtle cognac, hay and cobweb. Very full body, decent sourness the cognac is more pronounced in the mouth. Alcohol is noticeable slightly in the finish. Pretty well put together
Bottle - 100th Geuze on rate beer - pours gold white head - nose and taste of oak, cognac, tropical fruit, funk and lemon - medium body

Bottle, courtesy of Meilby. Pours golden with a small white head. Aroma of herbs,malt, lemon and yeast. Flavor is sweet and sour with some congac barrel notes, grapefruit, some mineral notes and fruitiness. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle, 375ml. An unlcear orange colored beer with an off-white head. The aroma is quite woody, oak of course, with a boozy touch. Grapefruit, resins and barnyard. Leather. Barnyard. It¬ís tart and full-bodied, with a good carbonation. Grassy, grapefruity, lemoy flavor with leather, barnyard notes and some oak. Booze too. Grapefruit juice. Lasting finish. Not as good as VAT 79, but sure a wonderful beer. Hope to repeat it some day. 170516

Bottle 375ml @ geokkjer
Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is tart with a notes of malt, barnyard, horse blanket, citrus, alcohol and hint of oak. Taste is light sweet and medium to heavy sour with a long tart, dry, funky, citrus and woody finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle at Haket, G√∂teborg, on May 13, 2017.Cloudy golden color, white head. Acidic, tart, fruity, Brett scent. Brett, fruity, nice taste. Brett, fruity, tart, pith aftertaste. Medium weak mouthfeel, no hop bitterness, but tart finish.
Backlog ocena przepisana z untapped w ramach uzupe≈Çnienia profilu. Piƒôkne - sk√≥ra i ser - to co pamiƒôtam.

Flaska fr√•n SB, delad med Simon och Emelie. Klar, guldig med vitt skum. Stor, ekig doft som drar √•t marsipan, n√•got n√∂tig ton som b√§st beskrivs som pistasch, sesamfr√∂n/sesamolja/sesamkakor och n√§stan tahini. √Ñven lite blommiga toner, typ maskros. Ganska sn√§ll och relativt ren syra i smaken. Blommiga toner, vitt vin, ekfat, n√§stan mousserande vitt vin, p√§ron, lite citruszest. I eftersmaken kommer de lite n√∂tiga tonerna tillbaka med en del sesamfr√∂n. L√§tt gr√§sig beska och lite v√§rmande alkoholton.

Leather, horse blanket, citrus in nose. Pours golden with white head. Taste is slightly sweet and moderately sour with funky notes, citrus, cereal and mild congac. Tart finish, fizzy carbonation, no trace of alcohol. Overall good, easy to drink but nothing extraordinary in my opinion.

Bottle at home, 07/05/17.
Clear golden orange with a well appointed white head that retains well.
Nose is wood must, damp alleyway, funk, rotting apple core, faint piss, dry rot.
Taste comprises horse blanket, nutty twang, lemon peel, damp hay, funk, sweet and sour apple skin, wood must, wet jitty. 
Medium bodied, spritzy carbonation, drying close that leaves a puckering reflection.
Solid number.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Bottle 375ml. corked @ Mig & √òlsnedkeren, Mejlgade 12, DK-8000 Aarhus, Denmark. [ As Boon Oude Geuze VAT 109 ].Clear medium orange colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, pale malt, moderate yeasty, barnyard, leather, grapes, apples,funky, manure. Flavor is moderate sweet and light to moderate acidic with a long duration, tart, barnyard, leather, sweet malt, manuer. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft to flat. [20170203]
 8-4-8-4-16

Bottled from Systembolaget 
Hazy golden. White head. 
Sweet and sour aroma with citrus. 
Smooth mouthfeel. 
Peel from citrus; sweet oranges, lemon in the flavour. 
Mmm!

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Hazy golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Fruit, tart, sour.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Tart, sour, fruit.
Klar brun farge med hvitt skum. Lukter sure b√¶r, eddik, litt eple. Syrlig frisk i smak. Noe t√∏rr fruktig ettersmak.

Gylden brun klar med lavt hvitt skum. Lukter b√¶reddik, rogneb√¶r og trevirke. Middels pluss i fylde. Sur s√• det holder, tytteb√¶r, rips, fatlagringen kommer godt fram i smaken, eik og noe vanilje. Lang avslutning. T√∏rr.
Bottle. Pours a hazy orange color with a small white head. Has a fruity funky barnyard aroma. Fruity sour tart funky flavor. Has a fruity sour tart funky citrus finish.

Bottle into a snifter showing hazy yellow with no head. 

The nose shows a lot of brett and horseblanket. 

The palate is light bodied and moderately carbonated. Moderately tart, lightly sweet, with strong flavors of brett and horseblanket. Light cognac flavors.
Mega, ale to mega sk√≥ra, kwa≈õno≈õƒá, dziko≈õƒá, bardzo pijalne. Niesamowite piwo.

22-APR-2017, bottle @Brewdog Berlin Mitte, with Ulkl√∏bben on "Then We Take Berlin Tour".
Hazy orange with a lasting, White head.
Tart citrus. Huge Brett. Oak, straw. Medium body. Smooth and sour. This i fantastic. Could inhale it all night.
L√§tt disig orange √∂l med ett vitt skum. Doften √§r vin√∂s med inslag av citrussyrlighet, h√∂, tr√§ och funkighet. Detsamma √•terkommer i smaken.

375mL corked & caged bottle from Carwyn Cellars. 
Pours a bright orange gold body, decent clarity, white foam.
Aroma is intense, quite funky - grapefruit rind, grainy malt, oak, hay, barnyard, dried herbs, stonefruits - plenty going on.
Lively carbonation not as lively as some, good length, acidity is very well tempered.
Palate is quite mellow yet complex - straw, grapefruit, lemon, orange, oak, hard cheese, slight brandy notes - very complex, delicate yet full on, as Lambics are.
Very good!
UPDATED: APR 28, 2017 Pour for the bottle. Pours cloudy orange with a thick white head. Cognac, strawberry, low carbonation somewhat viscous.

Bottle. Darker golden in color with a white head. Wooden barrels, bit of barnyard and some tart fruits in aroma. Really nice. Funky notes, some apples and sweet notes in taste. More wooden barrels and some sweet notes later on. However the finish is quite dry. Nice.

Bottle from systembolaget. 
Pours amber. 
Aroma of apples and barnyard. 
Smoot mouthfeel, medium tartness, lemon and funk.

Bottle from systembolaget 
Orange hazy white head 
Aroma of cellar, lovely apricot sour.
Taste sour, hint of sweet and some bitterness.

Bottle (Otter¬ís Promise). Clear gold, white head that fades to less than a coat but doesn¬ít disappear. Fine bead 3+ Aroma of damp straw, old lemons, apricots. Has depth. 8+ More nectarines than apricots in the taste, in that mid funky/ fruity brett way. More funky than sour and a little heavier on the palate than the aroma presaged. Not all that dry at the end. Yes, there¬ís a suggestion of brandy there as it warms. Pretty good.

Bottle: Served in a Cantillon glass:
Creamy white head. Hazy yellow orange body.
Nose leather, funk, farm, cellar, horseblanket, brett, wood, some cheese...
Quite classic but still a bit better...
Flavours of funk, subtle tart, wood, light citrus/lemon fruity tint, some cellar and brett tints, subtle farm tints, light tart and grape tints...
Aftertaste is funky, dusty citrus/lemon ish, farm and bretty tints with a woody edge...
Medium carbo, creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied.
Deliciously balanced, amazing taste! Great stuff!

text:
Vat 109 ma barwƒô niemal≈ºe pomara≈ÑczowƒÖ, r√≥wnomiernie opalizujƒÖcƒÖ.
Piana na poczƒÖtku do≈õƒá bujna, bia≈Ça, szybko redukujƒÖca siƒô do pier≈õcienia na powierzchni piwa, pozostawiajƒÖca po sobie skromny lacing.
Aromat hmm... pachnie fenomenalnie, to co najlepsze mo≈ºna wyobraziƒá sobie w tym stylu. ZaczynajƒÖc od poczƒÖtku, na pierwszy plan wybijajƒÖ siƒô zdecydowanie dzikie aromaty, jest tutaj sporo stajni, ≈õwie≈ºej sk√≥ry, trochƒô nut rustykalnych(zwietrza≈Çego siana), nastƒôpnie dochodzi przyjemna owocowo≈õƒá, swƒÖ obecno≈õƒá manifestujƒÖ gruszki, jab≈Çka oraz kwa≈õny agrest. PrzechodzƒÖc do smaku, po aromacie powinien byƒá r√≥wnie genialny, no i nie mam co do tego krzty wƒÖtpliwo≈õci. Oude geuze jest lekko kwa≈õne, wpadajƒÖce w cytrynƒô, po chwili dochodzƒÖ jab≈Çka, gruszki i kwa≈õny niedojrza≈Çy agrest. Nastƒôpnie dochodzƒÖ nuty funk, ≈õwie≈ºa sk√≥ra, stajnia, zwietrza≈Çe siano. Jakby tego by≈Ço ma≈Ço swƒÖ obecno≈õciƒÖ szczycƒÖ nas ple≈õ≈Ñ wraz z subtelnƒÖ zio≈Çowo≈õciƒÖ.
Piwo pozostawia uczucie szorstko≈õci na jƒôzyku, takiego lekkiego ≈õciƒÖgania, a finisz pozostaje w tonie zio≈Çowym.
Przy ka≈ºdym ≈Çyku geuze przyjemnie musuje na jƒôzyku. Pijalno≈õƒá pomimo tak du≈ºej z≈Ço≈ºono≈õci jest wysoka, ale chcesz braƒá ≈Çyki jak najmniejsze, ≈ºeby m√≥c d≈Çugo degustowaƒá w tak genialnym trunku.
Jest to bardzo z≈Ço≈ºone i genialne oude geuze, mo≈ºna w spokoju roz≈Ço≈ºyƒá ka≈ºdy jego element i z ka≈ºdƒÖ minutƒÖ rozp≈Çywaƒá siƒô bardziej w fotelu.
Almost clear, golden, big head, high carbonation. Aroma lots of leather, gooseberries, lemon apples. Medium sourness, medium body. Taste: lemon, hay. Woody and leathery finish, quite long and dry.

375ml bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy dark golden, medium size white head, some lacing. Oaky and mild funky aroma, apples, cheese, white wine vinegar, barnyard and hay. Medium to full bodied, fairly soft carbonation, tart and dry mouthfeel. Tart taste with mild funk, green apples, balsamic vinegar, earthy, leather, oaky, grapes and red bourgogne wine. Dry vinous finish. Solid blend!
Pale yellow with light haze. Aroma has some barnyard funk. Flavour is very dry and has some bitter yeast. Tart grapes. Dusty.

375ml bottle @HBF 2017 (thanks FatPhil). Pale golden color. Medium size, white head, disappears. Rubber, fruity, herbal, nutty, sour, yeasty in aroma. Fruity, hay, nutty, sweet, twiggy, earthy, yeasty and sour in taste. Farmhouse earthy in aftertaste. Super dry mouthfeel. Fizzy carbonation. Alcohol is well hidden. Very nice brew.

Flaska fr√•n SB. Smak och doft av ladug√•rd, gr√∂na vindruvor, fuktig tobak, tr√§, syrliga √§pplen, fl√§der och citrus. Sn√§ll syra men mycket karakt√§r, stor kropp men torr avslutning, beska med smak av grapefrukt. Mycket gott!
Hazy orange with a lasting white head. Funky aroma with wood, hay, grapefruit and earth. Sweetish and tart fruity and funky flavour with distinct oak character of vanilla and a little coconut.

(Bottle, 0.375 l - BB 18.04.2036, at HBF2017) The beer poured golden and lightly hazy. Its head was small and white. Aroma had wood, fruitiness, tartness and vomit. Palate was medium bodied and dry with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, sourness, tartness, wood and bitterness. Aftertaste was tart and bitter. A pleasant strong lambic.

Sample from the bottle at HBF 2017, Helsinki. Thanks to Anna! Colour is slightly cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Sourness, berries, red berries, some tartness and some citric elements.
Bottle from Flask. Hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, barnyard, lemon and wood. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 070417

18-03-17 // bottle at Le Petit Belge, Wiesbaden. Pours a cloudy orange lambic with a small white head. Nose is light sour, light oak, barnyard, farmhouse, funky. Taste is excellent balanced, very good on the tongue, light sweet light bitter medium sour, light green apples, oak, cognac notes in the end. Great.

Bottle @Pu≈Çapka, Gda≈Ñsk
Perfect balance and drinkability. Very real in a way reminiscent of citrus fruit. Slightly citric bitterness in the finish. Amazing
Bottle at home. Pours golden orange, nose is barnyard funk, oak, toffee, light fruit, taste is similar, bretty, sweet, little bit of caramel.

Right after opening aroma reminds me of riesling - pineapple, crisp - later on more fruity notes appear along with bretts. Taste is not very sour and is countered by a bit of sweetness which creates rather round gueuze - not too sharp. Slightly bitter aftertaste with a bit of cognac notes present. Very decent beer - I¬íve definitely enjoyed it.

Bottle. Stem glass. Amber, medium hazy with nice, white, semi-thick, moderate head. Strong gooseberries notes, wet leather, grapes. Taste is light to moderate sour with surprising semi-sweet notes. Slightly lemon, zesty and herbal. Texture is creamy and silky - I¬ím really surprised. Finish is creamy, leather, slightly bitter and slightly sour. Medium body, oily texture, average to lively carbonation. In overall nice, creamy, very good.
Zapach bardzo dziki - stajnia, mokre, albo nawet lekko zgni≈Çe siano. W smaku zdecydowanie wytrawne, owocowo-grejpfrutowa goryczka, bardzo ma≈Ço kwa≈õno≈õci. Lekkie w odbiorze, bardzo przyjemne.
W aromacie du≈ºo s≈Çodkich winogron, orzech√≥w w≈Çoskich i nafty. W smaku za to tyto≈Ñ, drewniane klimaty i sk√≥rzany pasek. Aftertaste to mocno ≈õciƒÖgajƒÖce taniny.
Very bitter, not too sour. Aroma of stable -> classic. Nice carbonation on the tongue. Tasty.

Green Apples, barn yard, citric, light oak and leaves. 
Hazy amber colour, medium off-white head, lacing.
Big tartness, light sweetness, light bitterness, vinegar, green Apples, light oak and good amount of funk.
Medium body, sharp carbonation, tart finish.
Lovely brew.
37.5cl bottle. hazy amber-orange color. medium white head. grape, apples, orange peal. nice tart finish. great.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2017 Flaska systembolaget. Disig gyllengul v√§tska med doft av citron, tr√§, harsyra, stall och, blommor och √§pplekart. Frisk och syrlig smak med spritig och torr munk√§nsla. Citron, vindruvor, √∂rter, halm och fat. Sp√§nnande spritigt inslag iom cognacfaten. Det blir en liten vassare smak med en tydlig kryddighet och djup.

Bottle. Clear golden with a large frothy off white head with good retention. Sour apples, barnyard, lemon, mold and damp wood in the nose. The flavour follows with damp wood, light vanilla or white oak, lemon, barnyard, minerals, sour apples. Medium body, mild sweetness, medium sour with lively carbonation. Long finish with barnyard, mold and apples. Very nice.

March 2017 - 37.5cl cork and cage bottle at t¬íBrugs Beertje after a Bruges canal boat trip, as ¬íOude Geuze Boon A L¬íAncienne VAT 109 Mono Blend¬í, 8.25%, into proper glassware. Chose this because at 15 euro it was the least marked-up bottle on the menu. Short review with Teresa. Pours dark orange, clear and sparkling, big dense foamy head leaves thick lacing. Aroma is woody, light soap, grape. Body is light with tingly carbonation. Taste is tart apples, woody, tangy grapefruit, lightly spiritous whisky vibe, oaky white wine, tart but not acidic. Quite good. (3.9)

Bottle 0.375l from De Bierkoning Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 19.03.2017. Pour it hazy golden color with small white head. Aroma funky, straw, lemony. Taste nice smooth flavor, nice barrel notes it has that cognac feel, pinch of vanilla, fizzy carbonation, pleasenr bittery finish, nice easy drinkable, medium to full body, thick feel, fizzy carbonation, long finish, perfect balanced.
W zapachu owocowo, trochƒô sk√≥rki pomara≈Ñczy. W smaku dosyƒá mocno cierpkie.
Bottle at Solar Eclipse part 3 - the darkest hours. Aroma of citrus, barnyard, funky, fruity with notes of wood and earth. Dry and mainly sour; tart. Light and juicy,
Bottle @ Solar Eclipse part 3 - The Darkest Night. Hazy orange body with a small white head. Yeast, fruity, citric, slight cognac notes.
Bottle @ Sanderslum Pubbens Vintage launch/Solar Eclipse pt. 3. - The darkest hours. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Funk, Wood, barnyard and cognac. Smooth and soft. Delicious.

Bottle at Solar Eclipse Part 3: The Darkest Hours. It pours hazy golden with a small white head. The aroma is oak, acid, barnyard and ripe fruit. The flavour is barnyard, sweet fruit, malt, very dry and light dusty. Dry finish with oaky cognac fruity notes.

The third one in this series of Boon Monoblends (a fourth is coming, I heard), this one consisting of lambic aged in a century-old ex-cognac barrel (90%) blended with 10% young lambic; the first Boon product which consists entirely of lambic brewed in Boon¬ís new brewhouse. Bottled on April 18th, 2016. Opens under high pressure, lots of smoke escaping from the bottle neck and even foam slowly rising to the opening and beyond, but perfectly manageable. Very thick, frothy, densely moussy, regularly shaped, off-white head, slowly diminishing and eventually showing holes in the middle, but in all very well retaining, crowning a beautifully deep orange-hued gold, cristal clear at first with columns of fierce bubbles rising up from the bottom; turns a warm hazy pure orange with sediment added in the very end (and with very careful pouring). Noble, quite idiosyncratic and very inviting, funky aroma of unripe green plums, yellow grapefruit peel, damp hay stacked in an old barn, old books with dried weeds between the pages, pierced by ¬ístings¬í of redcurrant, some of the typical Boon ¬íold lambic chlorine¬í but less so than in the previous editions, wet wood, old lemons, very old dry sherry, unripe gooseberries, wild apples and indeed a faint, sweetish hint of cognac (not less subtly so than in Cantillon¬ís 50¬∞ N - 4¬∞ E, so noticeable as a faint hint among all the lambic goodness); adding the sediment in the end, however, brings in a foul, almost rotting potato-like odour scarring this idyllic impression of a rural September afternoon - but then fades away again. Crisp onset, teeming with lambic esters of course, in a spritzy environment, almost cava-like; unripe stonefruit, wry grape peel and grapefruit tartness and bitterness, no sweetness worth mentioning; sedate lactic sourness dries the entire palate but the more vinegary or lemony acidity remains at bay and limits itself to gently sharpening the sides of the tongue, as is to be expected from a ¬ígeuze¬í containing 90% old lambic. Nice bready maltiness (and ¬íwheatiness¬í) support this expressive and still restrained array of sour and bitter fruits and leads them to an utterly quenching, bone dry finish where woody tannins coarsen the back of the mouth; an earthy, leafy and even briefly tonic water-like ¬íold¬í hop bitterness adds complexity and afterwards, a glow of ¬íjenever¬í-like alcohol is noticeable, but in the most subtle and elegant manner imaginable - if only it were this well-dosed in so many other 8% beers. Lovely stonefruit and green berry tartness linger in the throat. I will not take that weird ¬írotting¬í smell, which briefly showed up near the end of the bottle, into account here: like the previous Monoblends, this is a geuze of high class and stunning beauty, in which the old lambic character seems to be even more refined and balanced than in the two previous ones. Beautiful geuze, I am looking forward to the fourth one now.

Pours a beautiful hazy amber. Tart on the nose. 
Exquisite taste, sour floral at first, quickly replaced with deep bitter which stays with you for a long time and goes down smoothly.

Bottle at home. Taste of old oranges, lemon zest, green pepper, canned bamboo shoots and wet wood. Dry aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Hazy golden color white head. Dusty white pepper aroma. Taste is dusty funky peppery. Very good.
Elegant geuze. Feels crisp dry, white grape, fresh apple, moderate tartness, some wood kick. Liked it because of balance and refreshing aspect
Bottle at Lambicus. Orange colour with white head. Funk and dust aroma. Funk, tart, apple, fruit taste. Medium body.

Pours cloudy golden orange with a finger of white frothy head. Aroma of grass, green grapes and apples, hay and garden branches, mild bretta and citrus. Solid. Taste is gentle grape tart, green apples and funk, mild barrel sweet finish. Light and crisp yet smooth body with soft carbonation.

Bottle - Nice funk and some sweetness with white grape and a hint of nectarine. Cloudy gold with a rich white head. Light stone fruit, tartness and some green grape. Little punch in the finish and quite dry. Cognac appears slightly in the finish as it warms.

375 ml. bottle @ home. Bottled 18 April 2016. Darker orange lambiek, collapsing big fizzy white head. Nose is wonderful dried orange peel lambiek funk, all funk, almost old medicinal notes, dried oak, great old lemon funk, almost all funk with little sourness. Nose is just amazing. Taste is slightly lesser than nose but still very good, sweetish old lemon, sweeter medicinal, orange, medium funk, almost herbal, mildly sweet, good band aid for one, lemon, zest, bit sweet for the style, yellow apple, oak, flowers, almost sugar, brett, low toffee & agave, faintest of cobweb cellar notes, super faint sardine(? - might be wrong, haven¬ít eaten those in years). Bit sweeter than you would expect but otherwise really nice, carbonation is less high than you would expect. Very solid, I really should drink more lambiek. A style fit for kings & warlords.
Strong fruity aroma. Hazy orange with small white head. Mild fruity sourness followed by slight bitterness. Dry finish, bit dusty. Refreshing
Extreme strong aroma. Less of the strength in taste which is very sour with an it if aftertaste. Very refreshing
Corked bottle. Golden color. Dominating grapefruit, honey and a hint of oak in the aroma. Oaky citric honeyish flavor. Moderately sour. Surprisingly short aftertaste. SImply very good.

Brassata il 16 aprile 2014, imbottigliata il 18 aprile 2016, aperta il 24 febbraio 2017, 8,25% ABV.
Oro antico velato opalescente con schiuma bianca di media persistenza.
Aroma di mela verde, uva acerba, barrique, cuoio, cantina, lieve stallatico, frumento, note di cognac molto molto leggere che si iniziano a sentire quando la birra di scalda.
Al palato attacca con un acidulo fruttato acerbo molto gradevole, cuoio, barrique e note di cantina, successivamente un intermezzo erbaceo abbastanza secco che cede il passo a mela verde e uva a buccia bianca, cuoio e note legnose.
Man Mano che si scalda si presentano note di frutta a polpa gialla.
Retrolfatto di cuoio, mela verde e uva bianca, "horse blanket".
Corpo leggero, ben carbonata.

Flaska fr√•n boxbeer. √Ñppeljuicef√§rgad, mycket disig, kolsyra och en tjock skumpuck. Funkig doft med l√§tt doft av stall, fuktig tobak och tr√§ j√§mte syrliga √§pplen, fl√§der och citrus. Sn√§ll syra men mycket karakt√§r, stor kropp men torr avslutning med ganska tydlig grapebeska. Saknar djupet som en v√§lblandad gueuze har men annars finns inget att klaga p√•. Riktigt gott.

Bottle thanks to allmyvinyl.
Appearance - hazy golden orange. 
Nose - sour green note, geranium, elderflower, green pepper even.
Taste - really dry herbs, then lime pickle. Then it gets drier still. 
Palate - close to medium bodied with a dry zingy middle texture and a long dry finish. The sourness is actually hidden by the bitter green notes.
Overall - a beer of individual personality. Where is the Cognac? I don¬ít miss it, I just don¬ít see any influence.

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2017 375ml bottle from the Beerhive. Shared with Ashton McCobb. Pours hazy golden orange with a thin white head. Aromas of brett funk, dried orange peel, blossom. Hint of capsicum. Taste is sharp, zingy, lemon peel and lime pickle. Herbal notes too. Dry finish. Mmmmm. Cognac not a massive presence.

Hazy golden color with off-white head. Aroma is quite funky, lots of barnyard notes and hay. Taste follows, quite funky, earthy, dusty wood barrel, medium tartness. Light body, smooth mouthfeel. Overall it¬ís a really good gueuze with a nice mouthfeel and really well hidden ABV.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2017 Bottled. Dark golden coloured. Unclear. Dense light beige head. Aroma. Sourness, barnyard, leather, funk, wood, spice. Flavour. Leather, funk, barnyard, earth, wood, sourness, horseblanket. Medium to full bodied. Ends sour and citric and dry. Very nice.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking an Oude Geuze Boon √† l¬íAncienne - Vat 109 Mono Blend by Brouwerij Boon Bardzo fajna rownowaga owocowosci (jablko, agrest), bretowosci, kwasnosci, slodkosci leciutkiej owocowej, tanin, dlugie posmaki, ciut sciagaOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).Rami Rami is drinking an Oude Geuze Boon √† l¬íAncienne - Vat 109 Mono Blend by Brouwerij Boon at Saska Kƒôpa

Duzo kwasniejszy niz pamietam, mocno owocowy (cytryna, agrest), skorzanosc srednia, cierpki, cacyocenka usredniona z dwoch butli (4.2 i 3.8)
Bottle @ home, shared with my wife. Light hazy dark copper pour with a small head. Notes of citrus, light minerals, some light boozy notes, leather, some oaky vanilla and some pleasant funk.
Een typisch geur van geuze met nog iets erbij dat wat stinkt. De smaak is dan weer heel goed. Niet te zurig.

Donkerblond bier met weinig wit schuim. Geur: Vers hout, licht zoet, geroosterde hazelnoten, vanille, en ietwat kaneel. Smaak: vineus, licht zuur en licht bitter. Goede koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: licht zuur, tannine, en wat rood fruit. Deze is iets hoekiger dan VAT 79.

Bottle
Aroma-barnyard, floral
Appearance-golden, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, 
Palate-medium body, slick feel, lively, long finish, 
Overall-very good

Bottle. Pours bright hazy orange with a medium white head. Aromas of green apples, white grapes, musty cellar, brett, gooseberries, oak. Taste is musty, light bitter, grapey, green apples, citrussy zesty notes, gooseberries. Pretty nice. Could probably use a bit of time. Will be interesting to see how this one develops.
Bottle from Beirerei in Berlin. Fruity and very tart smell with wood and cellar notes. Similar taste. Very nice tartness.

Bottle @ Mig & √òlsnedkeren. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of light sourness, barnyard, dusty, wood, white grapes. Flavor is light sour, barnyard, wet wood, tart white grapes. Medium body, average carbonation, light acidic finish. Nice drinkability. 030217

Bottled. 30cl sample. The aroma has mandarins, funks, hints of cognac,light bread. Bit hazy, copper/orange coloured beer with a medium, off-white, lasting head. The taste is light-medium sour, tart, has citrus, mandarins, some apple, grapes, hint of cognac. Refreshing, very easy going considering its ABV. Very enjoyable!

Bottle. Pours hazy orange with a white head. Aroma is pretty fruity and not too oaky. Lots of funk though along with white grapes, citrus, Brett, Goose berries, lots of rosehip, green apples, slight leather, minerals and just a weak amount of oak in the back. Taste is tart with notes of green dry grapes, citrus, green apples, rosehip. Green apples, weak sweet barrel notes and dry white wine. Nice one!

Kolor: z≈Çocisty, lekko zamglony.
Piana: obfita, drobnopƒôcherzykowa, strzelajƒÖca, ale do≈õƒá trwa≈Ça.

Wysycenie: w kierunku wysokiego.

Bottle @ Pours hazy orange with a White head. Aroma of hay, barnyard, slight note of cognac, citrus, slight minerals, light touch of stone fruits. Taste is rather sour with lots good funky character, some sweet notes of cognac, stone fruits, citrus. Good stuff, good funk :)

hazy orange colour, minimal off-white head, aroma of wine cellar, lemony and vinegar notes, wood, tannines, some barnyard and lemongrass; taste of vinegar, lemon, woody-tannin like and a bit medicinal bitterness and hints of salty notes; good gueuze

0.375l bottle thanks to Lore. Hazy orange body white head. Aroma of orange zest, lemon zest, salt, bread and a tiny bit of cheese. Taste of bread, lime juice, vinegar, salt and some earth. Great gueuze. Hard to belive that this is 8% ABV.

375ml bottle enjoyed at the CPH penthouse. It pours hazy orange - amber with a medium white head. The aroma is fresh, bright, acidic,tart, gooseberry, white wine, stone fruit, musty barnyard, hay and oak. The taste is crisp, dry, tart, bright acidity, vinous, hay, gooseberry, white grape, some sherbet, funky barnyard and wood with a firm, dry finish. Medium body and moderate, foamy carbonation. Rather tasty and balanced. Very good.

First half of the bottle pours clear, second half a little more unclear but the overall look of it is that It¬ís an almost clear golden colour with a very fine lasting head. Looks very nice. The nose has sweet wood, almost a soft vanilla like sweetness and cooked apples and more lemony apple skin. Slight sour mineral note too. The taste is pungent but still ballanced, with nice flavours of apples, brett and lemons and only a nice hint of the cognac soaked barrel. As I recall, this has a more subtle cognac flavour than the Cantillon equivalent. Don¬ít know if a comparison makes sense but there you go. And I prefer this expression.. the 8.25% is very well hidden and after this settles, after about 20 minutes it becomes super well balanced. Tannins well present in the finish and a slight bitterness in the aftertaste. Very nice gueuze.

Bottle courtesy of hackobock. Hazy burnt yellow pour with a big frothy fizzy offwhite head. Funky citrus nose with grilled grapefruit, minerals, leather, horseblanket, barnyard & citrus zest. Light sourdough crackers & ripe cheese. Tiny sweet & slightly sour taste. Sparkling, tiny dry, slightly tart & tiny boozy mouthfeel. Overall a bit heavy. Prefer more buoyant gueuze. Very nice match with the flavourful St Agur blue cheese though. The heavy gueuze really stands its ground to it. Complex wood character really comes through as it opens up. This is a quite pleasant affair.

37.5 cl bottle. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is horseblanket, barnyard. Citrusy to orange fruity. Crisp sour, bretty and wooden. Lingering dry and sour finish. Light earthy and wooden.

A: Clear deep golden/light brown coloured with a thin white lacing N: Green apples, lemon zest, cognac, grapes, light funk T: Cognac! Green apples, litchi, plum, grapefruit zest O: Very nice nose to it! Quite complex. A bit "hot" cognac to it. Nice though!

Sample from bottle, poured a sticky golden colour with a non lasting head. Nose has big earthy cognac, earth notes, cotrus, dry apricots, yeast, grain and barnyard funk. Taste of big cognac notes, slight alcohol heat, citrus, funk and spiced brett. Amazing blend

Bottled. Pours slightly hazy deep golden with a small white head. Aroma of peach, cognac, wood, funk and barnyard. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up being more dry and a little tart. Medium bodied, oily texture and average carbonation. An excellent Gueuze indeed. üåüüåüüåüüåü

Bottle @ Mig & √òlsnedkeren hsared with Nick, 8.25%. clear golden with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, funk, tart, barnyard, little lemon, wood with notes of cognac. Flavour is malt, funk, tart, grapes, little lemon, little cognac, medium sweet, little sour, little dry, warming, barnyard and wood.

Bottle 37,5cl, a golden copper beer with low head. Nose is fruity on peach, lactic notes as well as wet wood. Taste is very dry with some acidity, this is driest beer I had from this brewery. Aroma is on herb, wet wood, yellow fruit, lactic notes, some taste "bouchonnee", lemon, green apples, pleasant.
375ml bottle at home. Pale orange with small white head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Nice tarty sourness with subtle sweet and bitter tones. Tart, sour fruits, grass and oak. Very good.

37.5cl bottle via Etre. It pours a clean golden color with a medium white head. Aroma is rich sweet moreish with notes of bread wood cognac light funk and medium tart lemon. Taste is also quite ¬íheavy¬í, sweet with notes of cognac wood and light booze. Some mild funk and decent tartlemon juice. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, seems less refined and complex than VAT 79, and pales when compared to the sheer complexity of 3F OG

Aroma: white grapes, hay, green bell pepper, alcohol
Taste: light sour, drugstore aromas, hay, oak, grapes, light leather
UPDATED: DEC 29, 2016 Heel erg complexe neus met goudbloem. Mooie volle smaak typische geuze met tannine en houttoets. Bittere afdronk. Zeer uitgebalanceerd.

Bottle from LDW, Eke. Hazy yellow/amber colour, creamy white foam. Lemony, barnyard, light sweet, fruity. Medium carbonation. Very well balanced. Some notes of cognac, oak. Wow, again a very nice geuze from Boon.

Fluffy white head, stable (!), over partly veiled, faintly orange-tinted golden beer; medium carbonation. Lemony, horseblanket, flowery aromas. Bit toasted too, wheat. Toasted, mellow, nearly sweet gueuze. Malts in the front, lemon in the background. Tart, but dried apples. Has some body even, as if the Bretts haven¬ít kicked in, yet. Medium carbonation. Honestly? A bit too malty, sweetish, for my liking, as a stabilized young lambic. OK for a malse  gueuze, but next we¬íll have a sweet one...  Thanks to Louis!

22/XI/16 - 37.5cl bottle, poured by Karel Boon @ HoReCa Expo (Gent) - BB: n/a (2016-1346) Thanks to kraddel and Erwin for sharing today¬ís beers!
Slightly hazy deep blond to orange beer, soft creamy dense off-white head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: dry, bit fruity, wood notes, some dried fruits, floral, blossoms, little funky. MF: lively carbon, medium body. Taste: dry sourish start, lemony, gentle fruity notes, citrus, some grapefruit, soft bitterness, tannins clearly present. Aftertaste: fruity touch, citrus, some grapefruit, bit of almonds, little bitter in the finish.

37cl bottle. Gusher! Spent about 10 minutes cleaning the kitchen before this review. Semi-hazy orange pour with a very tall and lively off-white head. Notes of peaches, macerated apples, gueuze funk, salt, baking soda. Just a hint of the cognac barrel in the aroma, nothing in the taste.

Bottle shared. Cloudy golden with a white head. Aroma shows off the cognac with oaky barrel notes, citrus, apple, and a nice soft funk. Flavour is light moderate sour. Medium bodied with light carbonation.
Pours unclear blonde, good white head. Smell is funky, oak. Bot fruity. Taste is full, oaky, bit apples, funk, intense. Really mellow. Very Nice
